request.description:
Signs up a user. `email` and `username` must be unique.

__TODO:__ After the creation of a user, the system sends an email for activation. After the activation, user can login.

__TODO:__ `tags` can also be sent, however I couldn't find the way to send array as form_data at this moment.

A sample request of user activation url. Note that the request goes to the backend and after the activation, the request is redirected to frontend login page with status code `301`. If the activation is not successful, `HTTP 406` error is returned. Frontend do not have to take any action but clarifying login url.

response.name: Redirect to Frontend Login Page

request.description:
User's new data fields should be put into JSON body. Multiple field update is possible. Note that `username` can't be changed, yet `email` can be. However, a unique email should be given.

__Updatable fields__: `email`, `password`, `first_name`, `last_name`, `bio`, `city`, `is_corporate_user`, `corporate_profile`, `tags`

__Readonly fields__: `id`, `username`, `comments`, `votes`, `follower_count`, `following_count`, `owned_events_count`, `blocked_users_count`

Note that readonly fields are not returning error status, but `200 OK` with user details only.

request.description: Returns all conversations of current user. User is either the owner or the participant of returned conversations. Conversations are returned in descending order according to their update time.

response.name: Get Conversations

request.description: If there is no conversation between current user and participant, a new conversation is created. Else, existing conversation is returned.
If there is no conversation between current user and participant, a new conversation is created. Else, existing conversation is returned.
Conversation must belong to current user and receiver.
Users can be searched by `username`, `first_name` and `last_name` fields.
Events can be searched by `title` and `description`fields.
